etymology.description: 厂(廠) (chǎng, 'factory') derived from an ideogrammic compound: 广(广) (guǎng, 'shelter') + 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') = A place beneath a shelter where people gather -> originally referred to a workshop or depot. The simplified form retains the 'shelter' meaning with just the 广(广) component.
etymology.interpretation: 厂(廠) (chǎng, 'factory') originally combined symbols for shelter and people gathering. The simplification to 厂 emphasizes its core idea of an area for work or storage, suitable for the modern meaning of 'factory'.
etymology.simplification: 广(广) (guǎng, 'shelter') is used alone to simplify the character by removing the 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth'), retaining the idea of a workspace.

examples.chinese: 这个厂生产汽车(這個廠生產汽車)。
那个厂明天开张(那個廠明天開張)，吸引了很多顾客(吸引了很多顧客)。
examples.pinyin: Nàgè chǎng míngtiān kāizhāng, xīyǐnle hěn duō gùkè.
examples.english: That factory will open tomorrow, attracting many customers.
